oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Hall of Fame Medallion Ceremony - Hargus "Pig" Robbins, Connie Smith, Garth Brooks - 2012-10-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country Music Hall of Fame medallion ceremony held on October 21, 2012 from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. Inductees honored were Hargus "Pig" Robbins, Connie Smith, Garth Brooks.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ronnie Dunn; Crystal Gayle; Gene Watson; Ronnie Milsap; Hargus "Pig" Robbins; Charlie McCoy; the Quebe Sisters; the Whites; Lee Ann Womack; Merle Haggard; Connie Smith; George Strait; James Taylor; Bob Seger;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress; Kyle Young introduces Steve Turner -- Comments from Steve Turner; introduction of Steve Moore; comments from Steve Moore; Hargus "Pig" Robbins segment; White Lightning (Ronnie Dunn); Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Blue (Crystal Gayle); Fourteen Carat Mind (Gene Watson); Charlie McCoy with the presentation of the medallion to Hargus Robbins -- comments from Hargus "Pig" Robbins; Behind Closed Doors (Ronnie Milsap with "Pig" Robbins); Connie Smith segment; Once A Day (the Quebe Sisters); If It Ain't Love [Let's Leave It Alone] (the Whites); You've Got Me (Lee Ann Womack); Merle Haggard with the presentation of the medallion to Connie Smith; comments from Connie Smith; When I Need Jesus, He's There (Connie Smith); Garth Brooks segment; Much Too Young [To Feel This Damn Old](George Strait); The River (James Taylor); That Summer (Bob Seger); George Strait with the presentation of the medallion to Garth Brooks; comments by Garth Brooks; Will The Circle Be Unbroken (assembled Country Music Hall of Fame members);
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Brooks, Garth; Robbins, Hargus "Pig"; Smith, Connie, 1941-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
